shortdesc.ph: Sets the user role and level in an interactive live streaming channel.

p.codeblock: public abstract int setClientRole(int role, ClientRoleOptions options);
virtual int setClientRole(CLIENT_ROLE_TYPE role, const ClientRoleOptions& options) = 0;
public abstract int SetClientRole(CLIENT_ROLE_TYPE role, ClientRoleOptions options);
Future<void> setClientRole( {required ClientRoleType role, ClientRoleOptions? options});

section.title: Details
section.p: In the interactive live streaming profile, the SDK sets the user role as audience by default. You can call this method to set the user role as host.
You can call this method either before or after joining a channel.

If you call this method to set the user's role as the host before joining the channel and set the local video property through the method, the local video preview is automatically enabled when the user joins the channel.

If you call this method to switch the user role after joining a channel, the SDK automatically does the following:
Calls and to change the publishing state.
Triggers on the local client.
Triggers or on the remote client.

The difference between this method and is that this method can set the user level in addition to the user role.
The user role (role) determines the permissions that the SDK grants to a user, such as permission to send local streams, receive remote streams, and push streams to a CDN address.
The user level (level) determines the level of services that a user can enjoy within the permissions of the user's role. For example, an audience member can choose to receive remote streams with low latency or ultra-low latency. User level affects the pricing of services.
section.note: This method applies to the interactive live streaming profile (the profile parameter of is set as ) only.

pt.props: native unreal flutter unity cs electron rn

pd.ph: The user role in the interactive live streaming.

ph.props: ios mac cpp unreal bp electron unity flutter rn cs
ios mac cpp unreal bp electron unity flutter rn cs

ul.li: (1): Host. A host can both send and receive streams.
(2): (Default) Audience. An audience member can only receive streams.

plentry.pd: The detailed options of a user, including the user level. See .

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown; and you need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See for details and resolution suggestions.

li.props: native unreal bp electron unity rn cs

ul.li:
< 0: Failure. See for details and resolution suggestions.
-1: A general error occurs (no specified reason).
-2: The parameter is invalid.
-5: The request is rejected.
-7: The SDK is not initialized.
